summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (FLS) staff regarding a proposed letter to Judge Davis about the Epstein case. The email discusses finalizing the number of victims to include in the letter and includes an attachment of the draft letter.

persons.name: Acosta, Alex
persons.context: Recipient of the email containing a proposed letter to Judge Davis regarding the Epstein case. He is being asked for his opinion on the draft.

persons.name: Judge Davis
persons.context: The intended recipient of a proposed letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein case, specifically concerning victim count.

connections.description: Acosta is preparing/sending a letter to Judge Davis regarding the Epstein case, specifically about victim information.

events.title: Drafting of Letter to Judge Davis
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office staff prepare and discuss a proposed letter to Judge Davis regarding the Epstein case, aiming to finalize the number of victims to include.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from October 15, 2007, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida (FLS).
It shows communication about drafting a letter from Alex Acosta to Judge Davis concerning the Jeffrey Epstein case.
A key point of the letter was to include the final number of victims, indicating an ongoing effort to quantify the scope of the abuse.
The email includes an attachment titled '071015_Special_Master_Letter.wpd', suggesting formal legal correspondence was being prepared.
The correspondence indicates coordination and review within the prosecution team regarding communication with the court.
